metadata.name: Project
metadata.description:
Project

Represents the project that pubsub messages are pushed to and pulled from. Topic is a named resource to which messages are sent by publishers. Subscription is a named resource representing the stream of messages from a single, specific topic, to be delivered to the subscribing application. Message is a combination of data and attributes that a publisher sends to a topic and is eventually delivered to subscribers.

See Gcloud#pubsub

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
topic.publish "task completed"

require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new "my-todo-project",
                    "/path/to/keyfile.json"
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

pubsub.project #=> "my-todo-project"

metadata.name: topic
metadata.description:
Retrieves topic by name.

The topic will be created if the topic does not exist and the autocreate option is set to true.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub
topic = pubsub.topic "existing-topic"

examples.caption: By default nil will be returned if the topic does not exist.
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub
topic = pubsub.topic "non-existing-topic" #=> nil

examples.caption: With the autocreate option set to true.
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub
topic = pubsub.topic "non-existing-topic", autocreate: true

examples.caption: Create a topic in a different project with the project flag.
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub
topic = pubsub.topic "another-topic", project: "another-project"

examples.caption: Skip the lookup against the service with skip_lookup:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub
topic = pubsub.topic "another-topic", skip_lookup: true

params.name: topic_name
params.description: Name of a topic.

params.name: autocreate
params.description: Flag to control whether the requested topic will be created if it does not exist. Ignored if skip_lookup is true. The default value is false.

params.name: project
params.description: If the topic belongs to a project other than the one currently connected to, the alternate project ID can be specified here.

params.name: skip_lookup
params.description: Optionally create a Topic object without verifying the topic resource exists on the Pub/Sub service. Calls made on this object will raise errors if the topic resource does not exist. Default is false.

returns.description: Returns nil if topic does not exist. Will return a newly created{ Gcloud::Pubsub::Topic} if the topic does not exist and autocreate is set to true.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub
topic = pubsub.create_topic "my-topic"

params.name: topic_name
params.description: Name of a topic.

metadata.name: topics
metadata.description: Retrieves a list of topics for the given project.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topics = pubsub.topics
topics.each do |topic|
  puts topic.name
end

examples.caption: With pagination: (See Topic::List#token)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

all_topics = []
tmp_topics = pubsub.topics
while tmp_topics.any? do
  tmp_topics.each do |topic|
    all_topics << topic
  end
  # break loop if no more topics available
  break if tmp_topics.token.nil?
  # get the next group of topics
  tmp_topics = pubsub.topics token: tmp_topics.token
end

params.name: token
params.description: The token value returned by the last call to topics; indicates that this is a continuation of a call, and that the system should return the next page of data.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of topics to return.

metadata.name: publish
metadata.description:
Publishes one or more messages to the given topic. The topic will be created if the topic does previously not exist and the autocreate option is provided.

A note about auto-creating the topic: Any message published to a topic without a subscription will be lost.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

msg = pubsub.publish "my-topic", "new-message"

examples.caption: Additionally, a message can be published with attributes:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

msg = pubsub.publish "my-topic", "new-message", foo: :bar,
                                                this: :that

examples.caption: Multiple messages can be sent at the same time using a block:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

msgs = pubsub.publish "my-topic" do |batch|
  batch.publish "new-message-1", foo: :bar
  batch.publish "new-message-2", foo: :baz
  batch.publish "new-message-3", foo: :bif
end

examples.caption: With autocreate:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

msg = pubsub.publish "new-topic", "new-message", autocreate: true

params.name: topic_name
params.description: Name of a topic.

params.name: data
params.description: The message data.

params.name: attributes
params.description: Optional attributes for the message.

params.name: attributes.autocreate
params.description: Flag to control whether the provided topic will be created if it does not exist.

params.name: yield
params.description: a block for publishing multiple messages in one request

params.name: yield.batch
params.description: the batch object

returns.description: Returns the published message when called without a block, or an array of messages when called with a block.

metadata.name: subscribe
metadata.description: Creates a new Subscription object for the provided topic. The topic will be created if the topic does previously not exist and the autocreate option is provided.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscribe "my-topic", "my-topic-sub"
puts sub.name # => "my-topic-sub"

examples.caption: The name is optional, and will be generated if not given.
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscribe "my-topic"
puts sub.name # => "generated-sub-name"

examples.caption: Wait 2 minutes for acknowledgement and push all to an endpoint:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscribe "my-topic", "my-topic-sub",
                       deadline: 120,
                       endpoint: "https://example.com/push"

examples.caption: With autocreate:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

sub = pubsub.subscribe "new-topic", "new-topic-sub", autocreate: true

params.name: topic_name
params.description: Name of a topic.

params.name: subscription_name
params.description: Name of the new subscription. Must start with a letter, and contain only letters ([A-Za-z]), numbers ([0-9], dashes (-), underscores (_), periods (.), tildes (~), plus (+) or percent signs (%). It must be between 3 and 255 characters in length, and it must not start with “goog”.

params.name: deadline
params.description: The maximum number of seconds after a subscriber receives a message before the subscriber should acknowledge the message.

params.name: endpoint
params.description: A URL locating the endpoint to which messages should be pushed.

params.name: autocreate
params.description: Flag to control whether the topic will be created if it does not exist.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

subscription = pubsub.subscription "my-sub"
puts subscription.name

examples.caption: Skip the lookup against the service with skip_lookup:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

# No API call is made to retrieve the subscription information.
subscription = pubsub.subscription "my-sub", skip_lookup: true
puts subscription.name

params.name: subscription_name
params.description: Name of a subscription.

params.name: project
params.description: If the subscription belongs to a project other than the one currently connected to, the alternate project ID can be specified here.

params.name: skip_lookup
params.description: Optionally create a Subscription object without verifying the subscription resource exists on the Pub/Sub service. Calls made on this object will raise errors if the service resource does not exist. Default is false.

returns.description: Returns nil if the subscription does not exist

metadata.name: subscriptions
metadata.description: Retrieves a list of subscriptions for the given project.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

subscriptions = pubsub.subscriptions
subscriptions.each do |subscription|
  puts subscription.name
end

examples.caption: With pagination: (See Subscription::List#token)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

all_subs = []
tmp_subs = pubsub.subscriptions
while tmp_subs.any? do
  tmp_subs.each do |subscription|
    all_subs << subscription
  end
  # break loop if no more subscriptions available
  break if tmp_subs.token.nil?
  # get the next group of subscriptions
  tmp_subs = pubsub.subscriptions token: tmp_subs.token
end

params.name: prefix
params.description: Filter results to subscriptions whose names begin with this prefix.

params.name: token
params.description: A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of subscriptions to return.

metadata.name: ensure_connection!
metadata.description: Raise an error unless an active connection is available.

metadata.name: publish_batch_messages
metadata.description: Call the publish API with arrays of data data and attrs.
